page.title: 08A walk through Thurlow
page.content: Square mellow red brick Victorian houses nestle behind clipped hedges next to strawberry pink or buff Suffolk-washed cottages, their thatched rooves capped with ornamental ridges. Small but stately Georgian houses stand in their rose-filled gardens across the foad from even older yellow-washed flat faced farmhouses with dormer windows in their steep tiled rooved. 17th century pargetting recalls the wealth of former years and brick and flint walls enclose neat gardens borders and manicured lawns. Low whitewashed cottages, upper windows peeping out beneath eyebrows of thatch stand in line with sturdy brick gabled estate houses, bearing the date 1901 and the cipher of the owner WHS. Several of the houses are an unusual blue wash, a plough decorates a garden in one road.
